website_summaries.verdict: Quality-constructed, universal active 3D glasses, for use with all DLP Link 3D projectors.
pros: Super fast 144 Hz refresh rate (backwards compatible to slower 120 Hz or 96 Hz)
Automatic power-off function within a minute of turning off projector
Made of top-quality, soft rubberized plastic
Much more comfortable than standard plastic 3D glasses
cons: Not for use with Samsung and Mitsubishi DLP televisions

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: My first home 3D movie that I watched with these glasses was Avatar., on my BenQ 2050 projector. Worked great! The lenses completely covered both eyes. No blurring. Picture darkened a bit, but that's expected for a home system, but when you're into the movie, you don't think about it. Comes in a cute box, with a soft cloth bag, lens cleaning cloth and USB cable that you plug into your own power source. I'll be ordering a few more.
customer_reviews.author: albyone

customer_reviews.title: The True Depth worked okay and the 3D was what I would refer to as good. Then I tried the pair I bought my ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially I ordered one pair of these for my wife because they work well with eye glasses. I also ordered a four pack of True Depth 3D Firestorm glasses. The True Depth worked okay and the 3D was what I would refer to as good. Then I tried the pair I bought my wife and was blown away at how much better they are. The Ultra Clear provide a much better 3D experience as far as picture quality goes. Secondly, the build quality is superior. And lastly, I just think they are far more comfortable to wear. Also, they block out most of the light surrounding the eye making the movie experience much more immersive.
customer_reviews.author: N. Schiltz

customer_reviews.title: Blurry and dark
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a while ago and didn't like them compared to my TrueDepth which unfortunately are not available anymore. After several years my TrueDepth stopped charging and I was forced to use these. What was a perfect picture on my new Benq is now 1 day later a dark blurry picture with cross talk on these. What a disappointment. I guess I'll start looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Marcpent

customer_reviews.title: Working with my benq TK800
customer_reviews.text: So I got these along with another brand to try and compare them before purchasing 4 more pairs. Will definitely go with these. I haven’t had any issues so far with my benq projector. I’ll give an update when I get the rest of the glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Kiu

customer_reviews.title: Ultra clear
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I purchased these glasses. I had to replace the pair that I originally bought when I got my 3D projector and to my surprise these glasses actually work better. Typically with my old pair I would have to increase the brightness of my display to compensate for the added darkness of the glasses but with these no adjustments need to be made. The only downside to these is there is no button to invert the lenses so sometimes I will have to do that through my projectors menu when activating 3D but that's not really a big deal. All in all I'm very happy with these and will buy again if ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: demonsRendangered

customer_reviews.title: These glasses ROCK
customer_reviews.text: I have two pair. Bought the first pair and tested it with my BenQ projector. After amazing results, bought the 2nd pair. Last night my son and I watched MegaMind 3D. I forgot I had the glasses on. No headaches, just enjoyment of a great 3D movie. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: databits

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: They fit over my glasses, are very comfortable to wear and work flawlessly. I was a little reluctant to buy these because I've never heard of the brand, have never seen 3D outside of the theater and had very low expectations of how it would look using a DLP projector (Optoma HD141X). Extremely surprised at how great the effect was. No regrets. For reference - fixed screen size is 120 inches, 13 ft cast. 3D image looks good with or without blackout curtains. The glasses seem very well constructed, charge via a powered USB port, have everything you need in the box. Have watched several movies without needing a recharge. Interested to see how long the battery lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewman

customer_reviews.title: Severe sync issues, not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Glasses are well-built with a solid design. Unfortunately, the pros end here. They frequently lose sync with my DLP projector, particularly during bright scenes. Not only do they lose sync, but they discolour the whole image to a nauseating degree before doing so. They're also front-heavy, and are uncomfortable after an hour or so. I was able to slightly improve the sync problem by covering part of the sensor with electrical tape, but this wasn't enough to completely resolve the problem. I'd recommend the Optoma ZD302 instead. Much lighter, and rock-solid sync.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Xiaomi DLP projectors
customer_reviews.text: While the build and ease of use of this item are fantastic. This item does not work with the Xiaomi Mi/WEMAX DLP projectors. There are sync issues and bad color drift. However these come with lens wipes, clear instructions and nice cloth carry case. The field of view is really good and so is the comfort. When the 3D works it looks amazingly crisp with these glasses!
customer_reviews.author: S.T.A.L.K.E.R

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck 3D glasses
customer_reviews.text: I've really liked these glasses. We bought 7 pairs so my wife, 5 kids and I could all watch 3D movies. Added to our 120 inch projector screen and Optoma 3D projector, these have been awesome. They're super easy to charge, hold a charge for a long time (multiple uses and 3+months and going) and very simple to turn on. The price is right where it should be for glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McMurphy

customer_reviews.title: Nice, inexpensive 3D
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use I'm very pleased with these. Worked well enough with my Optoma HD-142x projector that I bought a second pair. Tested this out with some youtube 3d videos (search for pop-out 3d SBS, then set the optoma for 3D side-by-side mode) and the videos looked great. Batteries are still going after a month although I've only watch may a couple of 3d movies a week since I've gotten these. Charging only took a short time anyway so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Schaumburg Bob

customer_reviews.title: Clearer and brighter 3D glass
customer_reviews.text: These 3D glasses are much more clearer and brighter than the other brand that I have. Well designed and much easier to use. The power button is well positioned and the USB port has a cover to close. Only downside is that these do not come with a soft case to store the glasses. I have to retain the hardboard box to store them
customer_reviews.author: Joel John

customer_reviews.title: Optoma HD25-LV and Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Glasses worked with my HD25-LV and Xbox One. Picture is just cast on a wall, nothing special. Glasses worked like a charm once all the projector and xbox settings were proper. Nice 3D effect. Good price for working DLP-Link 3D glasses.
customer_reviews.author: apextech

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DLP 3D glasses
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved from 2010 63" Samsung Plasma 3D TV to Benq HT1075 3D projector with 106" inch screen. As a 3D fan, I watch a lot of 3D movies, I can tell you these glasses are indeed excellent. Worked really well with Benq HT1075, syncing once in 3D is instant once you hit power button and the glasses were fully charged in about an hour. No ghosting, lose of sync, no yellow or red tint and they reserve brightness very well with no issues. For $25, I believe these are the best DLP 3D glasses available, if you have a DLP 3D projector, buy these now.
customer_reviews.author: HannooFX

customer_reviews.title: These work great!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a decent pair of 3D glasses for the projector I just purchased (Optoma 143X) and these work fantastic. I only tried one movie (Drive Angry) as a test, and played a PS4 game in 3D mode, and I am happy with the purchase. The brightness is a tad dim, but it doesn't take away from overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Rob

customer_reviews.title: 3D as it should be.
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I've never used active shutter 3D glasses and only bought them because a projector I installed had this feature. I'm not really sold on 3D but that's because I've only ever used passive 3D glasses. I immediately purchased another 2 pairs (4 total). They do have to be charged which doesn't take very long and they recommend charging every 30 days. I just simply bought multi usb charger and keep it near where I store the glasses. I don't know how much better are glasses that cost up to 4 times as much, but I can't ask for anything better than these.
customer_reviews.author: E Hagensen

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further....Get These And Prepare to be Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: After trying 4 different 3D Glasses (that didn't work or connect) with my Z4 Aurora, these work like a charge! I literary turn on the 3D option on my projector, turned on the glasses and instant connection. Just as the title says; they are Ultra Clear HD, I experienced little to no flickering in the first few seconds of connecting them and they are comfortable to wear over my glasses. I have four more all ready in my Wish list, and would differently recommend you buying a pair!
customer_reviews.author: God's Child

customer_reviews.title: I have a pretty expensive projector
customer_reviews.text: Looks absolutely incredible with my HD 3D projector. I have a pretty expensive projector, no brag intended. So, I can't vouch for their quality on lower end projectors but I'd imagine it's quite good. I have a 120 inch screen for my projector. Had some friends over to watch a 3D One Direction blu ray (don't judge me ha) and they said it was no different than being in a theatre. Can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality sharp image.
customer_reviews.text: works on my Projector Benq 2050A. I downloaded 3d movies and connected my laptop via HDMI to my projector then activate my 3d on my projector. Avatar looks super HD this glasses are super high quality.
customer_reviews.author: jose caldera

customer_reviews.title: great glasses, I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The 3D depth in these classes are superb, woukd definitely recommend. It made me watch over all my 3D movies, I got a different experience from them all.
customer_reviews.author: Kmak

customer_reviews.title: Long Battery Life IMO. Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use with an off brand 3D projector with DLP Link. You just start the movie and turn the glasses on. They sync immediately to my projector, haven't had a sync issue at all thus far. Also the battery life seems great to me.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Bought this glasses because of the many good reviews. I don't like them
customer_reviews.text: Bought this glasses because of the many good reviews. I don't like them, the make the image way darker than Optoma glasses that I bought for just $10 more. Also make the image very green, unlike the optomas, that darken the image some, much less than this, without adding any green tint. I would not buy them again, and would not recommend them to anyone when there are better options around for little more money.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Got Optoma GT5600 - Get IT!
customer_reviews.text: Although 1 of the original set failed the seller was understanding and sent a replacement. I'm extremely satisfied with this purchase. The colors, clarity and details are extraordinary with the Optoma GT5600 3d projector.
customer_reviews.author: Be'Jammin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality 3d glasses
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I had no problem at all with connection and synchronization on my projector. I own an Optoma hd144x and works perfectly just putting my projector to 3d mode and pressing the button of the glasses it synch immediately. My father wears eye glasses and didn't have any problem wearing the 3d glasses over them. Plastic quality looks good and fitts nice on head. They give a nice wide view, slightly darker but still better than other 3d glasses I owned.
customer_reviews.author: Ioannis Tsavdaridis

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Changed my Infocus IN8606 projector over to DLP-Link mode for 3D movies. Needed different type of 3D glasses. Ultra-Clear HD glasses worked first time used. But like previous 3D glasses, they reduce the picture brightness by 50%. I'm going to buy a new projector which has double the brightness. My present projector is only 2500 Lumens.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses, explicit packaging.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work great and never have a problem getting them to sync with the picture. The seem to hold a charge pretty long too. I deducted one star because of all the half naked women all over the box they come in. I was like what is with that? Seriously? I have little kids in the house and I did not need them nor I for that matter to see all these bikini sexy poses trying to get me to go to a website on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Cleary University

customer_reviews.title: Goes in and out
customer_reviews.text: They work good for the most part, but had trouble with multiple sets. The picture will flash and go from 3D to 2D at random times.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wear

customer_reviews.title: Viewing angles are great, you can turn your head from the screen ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of these to use with my Optoma HD141X. They work perfectly and I've had them for a year or two now. No problems to complain of at all. Viewing angles are great, you can turn your head from the screen and still see a good picture when watching a 3D movie. If I had to rate the quality, I'd have to say they provide a much better 3D movie experience than those found at the big movie theaters. I've very happy with them and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: good value- comfortable & reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: They are as comfortable as the $50 Optoma ones. No problems with them after about 10 uses, they hold a charge for a couple movies & charge quickly. The general consensus was that these are better than the style with open sides; they shield your periferal vision, which makes focusing on the movie easier.
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: Best DLP Link Glasses made.
customer_reviews.text: Good price, Great quality. I looked around a lot for good and cheap 3D DLP Link glasses, and these are what I kept coming back to. They fit my large head perfectly. After a few min, i even forgot I had them on till I started to walk out of my theater room with them :). I ordered a 2nd pair after getting to play with the first one and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.L.1203

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Glasses for Projector
customer_reviews.text: There aren't very many active 3D glasses for sale. I use these for watching 3D Blu Ray movies on my projector. They hold a good charge and are comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Work great with my Viewsonic projectoo!
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly well-made, and have a long battery life. They worked well for me, and my Viewsonic PX700HD, though I don't have much to compare with! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mork&Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable distortion and ghosting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with a couple other models, and found its performance to be in the middle of the pack. These were the only pair that correctly picked L/R sync every time, but they do have some noticeable ghosting and distortions if you try to look for them. All in all, the picture quality was good and I wouldn't mind watching an entire movie with them. I slightly prefer the IncrediSonic Vue Active for clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Works very good
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are awesome. They synced right up to my projector. 3d on 150 screen is as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cemental

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and cost
customer_reviews.text: Great active 3d glasses with a built in transmitter. Awesome. Lite. Great picture. Good buy. Have bought 2 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Adequate to do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I am using these glasses with my DLP sync projector feature, in well lit scenes the glasses are really great but in darker scenes they take away from the image a bit... I do not find the glasses comfortable for long periods of time, say an hour or more so I find my self constantly adjusting them on my face during a 90min movie. I think they are adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Gajit hown

customer_reviews.title: Bought two more pairs....
customer_reviews.text: They work great with my Optoma HD142x projector. I just ordered two more pairs. I also bought a pair of incredi Sonic glasses so I could compare them and the arm broke (temple?) the first time we used them. So I'm sticking with Ultra Clear now.
customer_reviews.author: Ted The Fiddler

customer_reviews.title: Works with BenQ HT3050
customer_reviews.text: These work fine with my BenQ DLP HD 1080p Projector HT3050 - I just wanted to comment that as people have said these are iffy with BenQ's.
customer_reviews.author: IAMRAMEKIN

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Little darker but I think that's just standard when watching something in 3D
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The 3D image was perfect and striking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these glasses in early October 2014. At first, I could not get them to work with my Optoma HD-131XE projector, but then discovered that I had to go into the projector's menu and make a switch from RF to DLP Link. Voila!! The 3D image was perfect and striking! They are well constructed, durable, comfortable and priced right. I just ordered four more pairs of these glasses today....
customer_reviews.author: Anim8r

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for the price if you’re looking for something on a budget these are it!
customer_reviews.author: Shad Clark

customer_reviews.title: but these are my favorite because they fit over my eyeglasses pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I've only used a couple of different 3d glasses, but these are my favorite because they fit over my eyeglasses pretty well. They work with any dlp capable tv/projector from what i understand (i have an optoma 3d projector and movies look ten times better than they do in the theater). Also, one charge seems to last through several movies, but its a good idea to charge them once a month or so even if you're not using them to maintain the battery.
customer_reviews.author: cletus

customer_reviews.title: Equal to Estars for half the price
customer_reviews.text: I have Estars glasses, purchased at Amazon as well, and these. From what I remember the Estars were twice the price. From what I experience there is no difference between either these or the Estars in any way...quality of 3d, glare, feel, etc. Only thing I can't comment on is battery life since I've only had them a short time. I'm using them for a Benq W1070
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable,long battery life, works great with my view sonic projector, will be buying more of these
customer_reviews.author: stefi

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: The only problem i have with these is that i guess i dont have a common face structure so even though i try putting the glasses closest to my eyes as possible, theres still a lot of places the light gets through from the sides... Other than that all is good.
customer_reviews.author: roy

customer_reviews.title: It’s good quality compared to same price on other hand
customer_reviews.text: A little concerning about disconnecting and back and im not sure if it’s the glasses or the projector
customer_reviews.author: Foxo

customer_reviews.title: So I wanted to buy like 4 pairs and didn't wanted to put so much ...
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted to buy like 4 pairs and didn't wanted to put so much on glasses considering we are not going to watch always 3D movies. This are cheaper than many other polarized 3D glasses but trust me this are one of the amazing 3D glasses out there. I loved it, invited my brother-in-law to watch Avatar in 3D and we enjoyed it a lot. It's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: SaChi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Glasses! Good fit for those who wear prescription ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Glasses! Good fit for those who wear prescription eyewear. Even my wife who doesn't like passive 3D glasses felt these were comfortable to view 3D. Didn't lose sync when I left the room for a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Viewsonic compatible
customer_reviews.text: Works with my Viewsonic PJD 5533W projector. Ultimate3DHeaven has a web site which I used to start up the glasses. It was very eady.
customer_reviews.author: FuSengRuMong

customer_reviews.title: not recommended purchased this item on December and after 1 use ...
customer_reviews.text: not recommended purchased this item on December and after 1 use it's good but in second time tested i noticed there is a line in left glass and didn't work any more
customer_reviews.author: Feras ibrahim alswayan

customer_reviews.title: I can see clearly now in Ultra Clear 3D
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with my DLP 3D Projector and have a good battery life. I don't use them very often but when I do , they always last through the movie which is all I can ask for. They sync up perfectly and work as I expected. Why spend the big bucks when you get the big savings with these !
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I think the E stars have better clarity and color rendition than these. I have both and spent about 30 comparing them stacked. I stacked them both on top of each other and kept flipping back and forth repeatedly. That was the only way to notice it, but it was there. There are great though!
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: so far these are the best. They seem to hold a charge for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of DLP Link glasses, so far these are the best. They seem to hold a charge for a long time, turn on in the correct LR orientation, and stay in sync over a good distance. Reasonable pricing.
customer_reviews.author: MAD 52

customer_reviews.title: Need help
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I recently purchased the Ultra-Clear DLP LINK for my Optoma HD 141X projector. I am having a hard time activating them. I point them to the screen and nothing happens so I point them to the projector and then start to synch but then it stops. I would appreciate if someone had an answer to this problem. Thank you for your help.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: simple & works nicely even if you have bulky glasses like I do
customer_reviews.text: simple & works nicely even if you have bulky glasses like I do, and actually more comfortable that the high end 3d TV glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Yousef Alhajeri

customer_reviews.title: Now I need another pair!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how other shutter glasses work, but I love these. They do exactly what they are supposed to do. The charging time was about 30 minutes and after that they worked perfectly. They are not heavy at all, and the fit makes me think that they will work for people that use optic glasses. They synced perfectly with my Acer K135, the picture was sharp, bright and clear even in a well lit room. Definetly recommned.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Soto Prado

customer_reviews.title: ... AVR S900W Optoma projector makes my home theater experience perfect. Watching my favorite programs and some Netflix movies .
customer_reviews.text: B-20 as front speakers C-20 as center speaker S-10 as surround speakers Denon AVR S900W Optoma projector makes my home theater experience perfect. Watching my favorite programs and some Netflix movies is very gratifying experience. 3D experience is mind blowing. Wow!!!!
customer_reviews.author: KSL0077

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've had some bad luck with the Viewsonic ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've had some bad luck with the Viewsonic branded glasses. I have owned 4 pairs, and 3 out of the 4 have died. So paying around $100 per pair is not for me. I figured I would try these. They work well with my projector. We will see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: supapowers77

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Never could get everything to work, so I don't know
customer_reviews.author: gordon ford

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Good job of eliminating the red effect
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Good job of eliminating the red effect. Fairly comfortable. Don't really care for the teeny-tight cover used to hide the charge connection.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.  Using it with LG PF1000U
customer_reviews.text: Just bought LG PF1000u, ultra short throw projector. LG did not even carry the required glasses. These 3D glasses are awesome. Price is pretty much 1/3 of what you will pay at a store (if you even find them). We bought one first to see, then bought 2 more. Really happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Simple no fuss product, work effectively with reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure in the beginning but after reading some reviews I decided to give this a try, with my Optoma HD-26. After full charge of the battery as instructed in the manual, I started to use this with my projector (you will need to activate the DLP link on the projector). It needed a couple of seconds to synchronize. The result is outstanding, no shadows, real vivid 3D. Great product, highly recommended, will buy again for other family members in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kunil

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: great 3d glasses. got these to replace some incredisonics that died on me after a month. have a these for a while now, and they are still going strong. No crosstalk that i can detect. good buy.
customer_reviews.author: SW2

customer_reviews.title: Buy in Multiples
customer_reviews.text: Great glasses can be a little uncomfortable at times but quality of vision is a plus and they take not time to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gladstone

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: Great Glasses ! buying again. BEWARE OTHER POSTINGS NOT FROM THIS SELLER ARE FAKE AND TRASH! THEY ARE NOT 3D AND JUST A SCAM!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: anita edwards

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Really wonder 3D glass. Watch Thor ragnarok and enjoyed the heck out of it.
customer_reviews.author: King Joffe

customer_reviews.title: the best 3D glasses I've ever used work so awesome with ...
customer_reviews.text: the best 3D glasses I've ever used work so awesome with my projection screen!! recommend to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Works well, comfortable, doesn't feel cheap
customer_reviews.text: They work with my Acer projector and are easy to calibrate to the projector. The image does get slightly darker. Also there are some strange ads on the side of the box, but a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: the eliminator

customer_reviews.title: Probably the BEST option - price
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works well on my Optima projector. Probably the BEST option - price, quality, and value.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Byron

customer_reviews.title: perfect 3d vision!
customer_reviews.text: You don't need the synchro for this glasses! , if you got a new 3d proyector (if this one doesn't need a synchro) this item is the best
customer_reviews.author: M. Chavez T

customer_reviews.title: Work and vastly superior when compared to Active Shutter DLP-LINK 3D Glasses for ...
customer_reviews.text: Work and vastly superior when compared to Active Shutter DLP-LINK 3D Glasses for Acer ViewSonic BenQ Vivitek Optoma Projectors .
customer_reviews.author: AKRANGER

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 3 pairs of these for over a year. Still work as they did in the first month. Holds a charge for about 3 movies or 6 weeks which ever is first. Works well with my optima projector.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses
customer_reviews.text: They are great , in the beginning they were not working well. Somebody said they are piece of junk and cheap They are not , go to the projector menu setup and try the 3d setup , and enjoy the show
customer_reviews.author: Syamani

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and work great
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work great! Pair instantly, charge quickly, and 3D movies look FANTASTIC using these. I'm quite happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: dan s

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I'll see how they last over time. I've seen other reviews criticizing their reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Davis

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, shutters are very fast
customer_reviews.text: fast charging, comfortable,shutters are very fast; no eye fatigue. The least amount of light loss that I have experienced with any active shutter glasses; priced right!
customer_reviews.author: Bart J. Zuccala

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D DLP_link 144Hz glasses
customer_reviews.text: These glasses work great! They synced perfectly with my benQ W770st project, once I found the right software, and stayed synced right through over three hours of playback on my PC. Good field of view with an eight foot screen from about fifteen feet. Only complaint, they might not fit over everyone's eyeglasses.
customer_reviews.author: Randal E. Sutherlin

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I love the product its the best one I found for my taste however I did receive one out of three damaged but they are willing to work with me on replacing it
customer_reviews.author: Charles Manuel

customer_reviews.title: One of the best 3D glasses

customer_reviews.author: Robert Munoz

customer_reviews.title: The best DLP 3D glasses I've tried but not quite perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a few times with my ViewSonic 3D 1080p projector, PS3/PS4, and projector screen. They worked fine. I had to replace my white SainSonic 3D glasses which were worthless - they stopped working because if you don't use them regularly they just die! These glasses at least have instructions that mention that you need to use and charge them once a month. Which is a pain for people who don't watch 3D movies once a month, but I guess that's as far as 3D DLP technology has come. They're not uncomfortable. My main complaint is the little rubber cover over the USB charger port. It's tough to open.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Good pair of 3D glasses. No darkening noticeable like reported for other brands. Overall very happy.

customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, well built, decent material (not fragile plastic like some others), about as good of a 3d image you’re gonna get with dlp-link on a projector

product_meta.title: Ultra-Clear HD 144 Hz DLP Link 3D Active Rechargeable Shutter Glasses for All 3D DLP Projectors - BenQ, Optoma, Dell, Mitsubishi, Samsung, Acer, Vivitek, NEC, Sharp, ViewSonic & Endless Others!
product_meta.description:
Our Premium DLP Link 3D Glasses couldn’t be easier to use: 

- Take off the protective film covers on the front and back of both lenses of your 3D glasses
- Put on your favorite 3D program
- Turn on the DLP Link option (via your projectors on screen menu options) 
- Sit back and enjoy the 3D experience of a lifetime! 

Includes carrying bag, microfiber cleaning cloth, USB charging cable and Indestructible Storage Box/Case! 

Steel hinges and durable frames ensure a soft comfortable fit. Finally glasses that feel and look as good as designer sunglasses! 

Super Soft Black Rubberized Top Quality 3D Glasses (much more comfortable than lower quality standard plastic 3D glasses)! 

Next Generation Super Fast 144Hz Refresh Rate (Backwards Compatible to slower 120Hz or 96Hz). No Emitter required! 

Optimized for 3D Projectors (Not For Use With Samsung and Mitsubishi DLP Televisions)

Fully Compatible with all DLP Link 3D Projectors including:
3M 
Acer 
ASK Proxima 
Casio 
Dell 
Digital Projection 
EIKI 
HD Projector World 
InFocus 
LG 
Mitsubishi 
NEC 
Optima 
ProjectionDesign 
Ricoh 
Runco 
Samsung 
Sharp 
Smart Technologies 
Specktron 
Viewsonic 
Vivitek 
& any other 3D DLP Link Projector not listed above 

Please Note for BenQ 3D Projectors only we recommend Adult DLP LINK eD Elite 144 Hz 3D Glasses (eDimensional Active Rechargeable) for All 3D DLP Projectors. As certain newer BenQ 3D Projectors are putting off too strong of a signal. You can still use the 3DHeaven version DLP Link 3D glasses if you put a piece of scotch tape across part of the receiver on the front of the 3DHeaven version DLP Link 3D glasses. Thanks for Looking!

Ultra-Clear HD as a registered trademark of Ultimate3DHeaven
